result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Alanzo Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs to be deducted from prison wages or by 11.3.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges to be deducted from prison wages or by 11.3.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derek Alanzo Williams in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Defendant Derek Alanzo Williams in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1. On the motion of the State, Court orders COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Statements made as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS and 6 MONTHS, with credit for 180 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs to be deducted from prison wages or by 11.3.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges to be deducted from prison wages or by 11.3.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
- submissions of defense, filed.

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Derek Alanzo Williams not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-05-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Derek Alanzo Williams not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Derek Alanzo Williams not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Derek Alanzo Williams not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant not produced. Defense counsel waives defendants appearance.
Br. 17 for Br. 7. 
Bail Review Hearing held. Arguments heard as to bail. For the reasons placed on the record the Court denies the Defense motion to modify bail. Cash bail to remain as previously set. 
Court orders Defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Intensive Supervision, GPS Monitoring/24 hours curfew.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no alcohol. No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping. 
Case is adjourned for Status Conference on 4-2-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 7.  Status conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Derek Alanzo Williams not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 7.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 03-05-2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Derek Alanzo Williams in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Defendant Derek Alanzo Williams in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #09CF1178 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Robert Gregory-MPD Officer.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Derek Alanzo Williams in court with attorney Mary Dorothy Scholle.  Defendant Derek Alanzo Williams in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY to count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
